medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset periumbilical pain associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until the afternoon when he developed acute abdominal pain that started periumbilically and then migrated to the right lower quadrant, becoming crampy in nature. He also reports subjective fevers and chills and states that bumps in the road during transport were quite painful.
